object.name: blackberry.ui.menu.MenuItem
object.comment: The MenuItem object represents a menu item for the screen.
object.details: The MenuItem object is an instance object, where if a new instance is desired, it must be created using the new keyword.
object.example:
<script type="text/javascript">
  var item = new blackberry.ui.menu.MenuItem(false, 1, "Hello World", clickMe);
  blackberry.ui.menu.addMenuItem(item);
  function clickMe() {
    alert("user just clicked me");
  }
</script>

object.name: OnClick
object.details: This is the interface that must be available on the click callback function provided.

ctor.comment: Constructor for a new MenuItem object

param.name: isSeparator
param.comment: If set to true the MenuItem will be created as a separator.

param.name: ordinal
param.comment: The ordinal of this MenuItem. Ordinal has to be greater than or equal to zero. Exception will be thrown if it is less than zero.

param.name: caption
param.comment: Optional text to display on the menu item. This must be supplied if isSeparator is false.

param.name: callback
param.comment: Optional parameter to specify the function to call when the user clicks the menu item. If supplied when isSeparator is true, an exception will be thrown.

property.name: caption
property.comment: Contains the caption for the menu item.

property.name: ordinal
property.comment: Each MenuItem has an ordinal specifying the sort order within the menu. MenuItems with a lower ordinal will have higher positions on the menu than the MenuItems with higher ordinal. A separator will be automatically inserted between adjacent items whose ordinals differ by at least 0x00010000.

property.name: isSeparator
property.comment: Value is true if the menu item is a separator.

property.name: isDefault
property.comment: Value is true if the menu item is marked as the default item to be selected in the menu.
